paragraphs.content: Chapter 6
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 6

paragraphs.content: My son, if thou be surety for thy friend, if thou hast stricken thy hand with a stranger,
paragraphs.contentHtml: My son, if thou be surety for thy friend, if thou hast stricken thy hand with a stranger,

paragraphs.content: Thou art snared with the words of thy mouth, thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou art snared with the words of thy mouth, thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.

paragraphs.content: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, when thou art come into the hand of thy friend; go, humble thyself, and make sure thy friend.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, when thou art come into the hand of thy friend; go, humble thyself, and make sure thy friend.

paragraphs.content: Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.

paragraphs.content: Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand of the hunter, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand of the hunter, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:

paragraphs.content: Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler,

paragraphs.content: Provideth her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Provideth her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.

paragraphs.content: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?
paragraphs.contentHtml: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?

paragraphs.content: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:

paragraphs.content: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth, and thy want as an armed man.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth, and thy want as an armed man.

paragraphs.content: ¶ A naughty person, a wicked man, walketh with a froward mouth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ A naughty person, a wicked man, walketh with a froward mouth.

paragraphs.content: He winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers;
paragraphs.contentHtml: He winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers;

paragraphs.content: Frowardness is in his heart, he deviseth mischief continually; he soweth discord.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Frowardness is in his heart, he deviseth mischief continually; he soweth discord.

paragraphs.content: Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; suddenly shall he be broken without remedy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; suddenly shall he be broken without remedy.

paragraphs.content: ¶ These six things doth the LORD hate: yea, seven are an abomination unto him:
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ These six things doth the Lord hate: yea, seven are an abomination unto him:

paragraphs.content: A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,
paragraphs.contentHtml: A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,

paragraphs.content: An heart that deviseth wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief,
paragraphs.contentHtml: An heart that deviseth wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief,

paragraphs.content: A false witness that speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A false witness that speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren.

paragraphs.content: ¶ My son, keep thy father’s commandment, and forsake not the law of thy mother:
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ My son, keep thy father’s commandment, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

paragraphs.content: Bind them continually upon thine heart, and tie them about thy neck.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Bind them continually upon thine heart, and tie them about thy neck.

paragraphs.content: When thou goest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When thou goest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.

paragraphs.content: For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:

paragraphs.content: To keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.

paragraphs.content: Lust not after her beauty in thine heart; neither let her take thee with her eyelids.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lust not after her beauty in thine heart; neither let her take thee with her eyelids.

paragraphs.content: For by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of bread: and the adulteress will hunt for the precious life.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of bread: and the adulteress will hunt for the precious life.

paragraphs.content: Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burned?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burned?

paragraphs.content: Can one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be burned?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Can one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be burned?

paragraphs.content: So he that goeth in to his neighbour’s wife; whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So he that goeth in to his neighbour’s wife; whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent.

paragraphs.content: Men do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Men do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;

paragraphs.content: But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all the substance of his house.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all the substance of his house.

paragraphs.content: But whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding: he that doeth it destroyeth his own soul.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding: he that doeth it destroyeth his own soul.

paragraphs.content: A wound and dishonour shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A wound and dishonour shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away.

paragraphs.content: For jealousy is the rage of a man: therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For jealousy is the rage of a man: therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.

paragraphs.content: He will not regard any ransom; neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He will not regard any ransom; neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.
